data.text:
Well it will be in a day or two - just compiling, writing & double checking it - half-way there, if all goes well, be up tomorrow, telling you where they are now & if they're still alive! Be patient now...

Okay, first batch now: (2nd batch tomorrow)

With all these questions popping up about how they're doing these days, I've decided that now is the right time to do this. I had wanted to put this on a website, put time, knowhow etc. are against me, even whilst I've got a break now, so rather than clutter more webspace up, I've put it on TNF so that anyone interested can share the results of my findings.

As you know I specialise in the Grand Prix drivers & specifically, their wherabouts these days - it's something I've been doing since 1992 & I've reached a zenith now, I think. I've tried to check these against as many references as I can find but I still am aware that the dates I put down vary from others - so- rather than shooting me down in flames if I've got something wrong or something different or I'm missing something - tell me what's different as I want to be as accurate as possible for my own benefit, so we can all get our facts right together - I certainly don't claim to be the definitive guide here! So deep breath here goes:

George Abecassis (GB) b. 21/3/1913, Chertsey, Surrey d. 18/12/1991, Ibstone, nr. High Wycombe, Buckinghamshire:- Former stalwart of the HWM team, died peacefully at his home

Kenneth Acheson (GB) b. 27/11/1957, Cookstown, Co Tyrone, Northern Ireland : - A successful sportscar driver until a huge crash at Daytona in 1996 saw him retire from racing pretty soon afterwards

Philippe Adams (B) b. 19/11/1969, Mouscron: - successful driver in lower formulae but F1 was a nightmare - mostly racing in procars/sportscars in Belgium at the moment

Kurt Adolff (D) b. 5/11/1921, Stuggart: -mostly raced in Germany but nowt known about activities since 1953!

Kurt Ahrens Jr (D) b. 19/4/1940, Braunschweig, nr Hanover:- decent driver who retired from racing in 1970's - often seen around the historic racing scene in his homeland

Michele Alboreto (I) b. 23/12/1956, Milan d. 25/4/2001, Lausitz circuit nr Dresden, Germany:- Gentleman & runner-up in the 1985 series. He went on to be a superb sportscar driver but whilst testing an Audi , a puncture at 200mph saw him crash into the barriers, Michele being killed instantly.

Jean Alesi (F) b. 11/6/1964, Avignon:- Still in F1, after 200+ GP's. Currently racing for Jordan.

Philippe Alliot (F) b. 27/7/1954, Voves Eure et Loir, nr Chartres:- no longer uses the black hair dye so looks a lot older than his 47 years - largely involved in French racing administration & still races sporadically, mainly in sportscars or rallies.

Cliff Allison (GB) b. 8/2/1932, Brough, Westmoreland:- tough competitor, who after a series of crashes was forced to retire with leg injuries, which still affect him today. Very happily retired, he has recently been driving the cars of yesteryear either for magazine features or in historic festivals

Fernando Alonso (ESP) b. 29/7/1981, Oviedo:- Still in F1, 2001 with Minardi , 2002 unclear yet

Chris Amon (NZ) b. 20/7/1943, Bulls:- One of the most talented drivers never to win a championship race, Amon quit F1 in 1977 to tend the family farm, something which he still has a hand in. Also tested suspensions for a while for Toyota

Bob Anderson (GB) b. 19/5/1931, Hendon, London d. 14/8/1967, Northampton:- Brilliant privateer, died after a testing crash at Silverstone

Conny Andersson (S) b. 28/12/1939, Alingas :- Left F1 after little luck in 1977. Little heard of recently

Mario Andretti (US) b. 28/2/1940, Montona, Italy: - 1978 World Champion, raced for years in CART races & now largely attends races as a spectator/consultant although still drives occasionally in sportscars etc.

Michael Andretti (USA) b. 5/10/1962, Bethlehem, Pennsylvania:- Still in Champ Car racing, where he is a legend & in the hunt for the 2001 crown. F1 proved a big disappointment all around.

Marco Apicella (I) b. 7/10/1965, Bologna:- One-off drive for Jordan in 1993 - did race in F3000 but now back in sportscars

Rene Arnoux (F) b. 4/7/1948, Pontcharra, nr. Grenoble:- More or less retired from driving & has been working as driver coach (to Diniz) & also as a TV summariser for Italian TV

Peter Arundell (GB) b. 8/11/1933, Ilford, Essex:- Still makes appearances (very rarely driving) in historic events

Alberto Ascari (I) b. 13/7/1918, Milan d. 26/5/1955, Monza:- One of the all-time greats, he was killed in a testing accident in his Ferrari sportscar

Peter Ashdown (GB) b. 16/10/1934, Danbury, nr. Chelmsford, Essex:- Any ideas?

Ian Ashley (GB) b. 26/10/1947, Wuppertal, Germany:- Raced in BTCC in 1993, then went into sidecars. In 1999 he quit as a pilot & raced in the TVR Tuscan series - he has also taken up fencing recently!

Gerry Ashmore (GB) b. 25/7/1936, West Bromwich, Staffordshire:- Still attends yearly reunions

Bill Aston (GB) b. 29/3/1900 Stafford d. 4/3/1974, Lingfield, Surrey

Richard Attwood (GB) b. 4/4/1940, Wolverhampton, Staffordshire:- Last raced in the mid 80's but did some development & testing work for Vauxhall in early 90's.

Luca Badoer (I) b. 25/1/1971, Montebelluna, Treviso:- Still in F1, as Ferrari's test, reserve & development driver

Giancarlo Baghetti (I) b. 25/12/1934, Milan d. 27/11/1995, Milan:- Photojournalist for ages until he died of cancer

Julian Bailey (GB) b. 9/10/1961, Woolwich, London:- Still racing in sportscars, won the 1999 Privilege Insurance GT series

Mauro Baldi (I) b. 31/1/1954, Reggio-Emilia:- Still in sportscars, mostly in America

Marcel Balsa (F) b. 1/1/1909 Saint Frion d. 11/8/1984

Lorenzo Bandini (I) b. 21/12/1935, Barce, Cyrenaica, Libya d. 10/5/1967, Monte Carlo: - very fast driver who died from burns after a crash in the 1967 Monaco GP

Fabrizio Barbazza (I) b. 2/4/1963, Monza:- Suffered a huge accident at Road Atlanta in 1995, which nearly killed him. Retired & has since been working on development of safety features (mostly armco design) for racing circuits

John Barber (GB) b. c.1929 - A Billingsgate fish merchant, who after loads of research, is completely untraceable

Skip Barber (US) b. 16/11/1936, Philadelphia, Pennsylvania:- Formed & still involved in his successful racing school & series - the Barber Dodge Pro Series

Paolo Barilla (I) b. 20/4/1961, Milan:- Part of the family pasta firm, he now works at the very top - mostly in publicity

Rubens Barrichello (BR) b. 23/5/1972, Sao Paulo:- Still in F1, with Ferrari until the end of 2002

Edgar Barth (D) b. 26/1/1917, Herold-Erzegeberge d. 20/5/1965, Ludwigsburg nr Stuttgart: - died of cancer

Giorgio Bassi (I) b. 20/1/1934, Milan

Erwin Bauer (D) b. 17/7/1912, Stuttgart d. 2/6/1958, Cologne:- killed in 1958 Nurburgring 1000 Km

Elie Bayol (F) b. 28/2/1914, Marseille d. 25/5/1995, La Ciotat

Don Beauman (GB) b. 26/7/1928 d. 9/7/1955, Rathnew, County Wicklow, Republic of Ireland:- Killed in sportscar crash

Karl-Gunther Bechem (D) b. 21/12/1921, Hagen:- Also raced under the name "Bernd Nacke" Was alive & enjoying retirement a year ago

Jean Behra (F) b. 16/2/1921, Nice d. 1/8/1959, AVUS, Berlin, Germany:- Fantastic driver, never won a GP, sadly killed in horrible accident on AVUS circuit in support race for German GP

Derek Bell (GB) b. 31/10/1941, Pinner, Middlesex:- Sportscar legend, still involved in the field but mainly as consultant these days

Stefan Bellof (D) b. 20/11/1957, Giessen d. 1/9/1985, Spa-Francorchamps Circuit, Belgium:- Great talent killed in Spa 1000 Km

Paul Belmondo (F) b. 23/4/1963, Boulogne-Billancourt nr Paris:- Now runs & still drives in his own sportscar team

Tom Belso (DK) b. 27/8/1942, Copenhagen

Jean Pierre Beltoise (F) b. 26/4/1937:- Now retired from business, follows his sons Julien & latterly Anthony, so JPB is often seen at the Porsche Supercup races

Olivier Beretta (MC) b. 23/11/1969, Monte Carlo:- Now one of the world's top sportscar drivers

Allen Berg (CDN) b. 1/8/1961, Calgary, Alberta:- Did race until very recently in single-seater series in Mexico

Georges Berger (B) b. 14/9/1918, Brussels d. 23/8/1967, Nurburgring, Germany :- Killed in endurance race

Gerhard Berger (A) b. 27/8/1959, Worgl, Innsbruck: - Now involved heavily with Williams as BMW head of motor sport

Eric Bernard (F) b. 26/8/1964, Istres:- Now in US Sportscars series

Enrique Bernoldi (BR) b. 19/10/1977, Curitiba:- Still in F1 with Arrows, but 2002 looks uncertain

Mike Beuttler (GB) b. 13/8/1940, Cairo, Egypt d. 29/12/1988, San Francisco, California, USA

Lucien Bianchi (B) b. 10/11/1934, Milan, Italy d. 30/3/1969, Le Mans, France:- Killed in test for '69 race.

Gino Bianco (I/B) b. 22/7/1916, Milan, Italy d. 17/1/1983:- Holder of dual passport

Hans Binder (A) b. 12/6/1948, Zell am Ziller, nr Innsbruck

Clemente Biondetti (I) b. 18/8/1898, Budduso, Sardinia d. 24/2/1955, Florence:- Died of cancer

'B Bira' - Prince Birabongse (T) b. 15/7/1914, Bangkok d. 23/12/1985, Baron's Court, London England - Prince of Siam who was excellent racing driver. Died after short illness

Pablo Birger (RA) b. 6/1/1924, Buenos Aires d. 9/3/1966, Buenos Aires

Harry Blanchard (USA) b. 20/7/1931 d. 31/1/1960, Buenos Aires, Argentina:- Killed in sportscar crash

Michael Bleekemolen (NL) b. 2/10/1949:- Now a very successful businessman & still races with his sons to this day

Trevor Blokdyk (ZA) b. 30/11/1935, Krugersdorp, Transvaal d. 19/3/1995, Hekpoort, nr. Krugersdorp:- became a farmer until his death from a heart attack

Mark Blundell (GB) b. 8/4/1966, Barnet, Hertfordshire:- for years he raced CART, now mainly ITV's summariser although he still races sportscars

Raul Boesel (BR) b. 4/12/1957, Curitiba:- Formed a successful career in CARt & latterly sportscars

Bob Bondurant (USA) b. 27/4/1933, Evanston, Illinois:- After F1, he went on to do his driving schools - drove ocassionally & does the odd TV commentary

Felice Bonetto (I) b. 9/6/1903, Brescia d. 21/11/1953, Silao, Mexico - "Il Pirata" was killed in Carrera Panamericana.

Joakim Bonnier (S) b. 31/1/1930, Stockholm d. 11/6/1972, Le Mans Circuit, France: Killed after collision in 1972 event.

Roberto Bonomi (RA) b. 30/9/1919, Buenos Aires: - Argentine landowner

Tommy 'Slim' Borgudd (S) b. 25/11/1946, Borgholm nr Kalmar:- ex drummer (notably with ABBA), went on to race teucks & now touring cars in his homeland

Luki Botha (ZA) b. 16/1/1930

Jean-Christophe Boullion (F) b. 27/12/1969, Saint Brieuc, nr. Cote d'Amor:- After spell in BTCC, now in sportscars

Thierry Boutsen (B) b. 13/7/1957, Brussels:- Raced until heavy crash at 1999 Le Mans. Now re-married & in his own aviation business

David Brabham (AUS) b. 5/9/1965, Wimbledon, London, England:- Top sportscar racer

Sir Jack Brabham (AUS) b. 2/4/1926, Hurtsville nr. Sydney:- GP legend, now largely retired & follows the racing fortunes of his sons, although still races in historic events, despite a big crash at Goodwood in 1999.

Bill Brack (CDN) b. 26/12/1935, Toronto

Vittorio Brambilla (I) b. 11/11/1937, Monza d. 26/5/2001, Camparada di Lesmo, Brianza:- Retired to run Monza workshop with brother Ernesto & his family until he died of a heart attack whilst in his garden.

Antonio Branca (CH) b. 15/9/1916, Sion d. 10/5/1985, Sierre

Eric Brandon (GB) b. 18/7/1920, east London d. 8/8/1982, Hampshire

Tommy Bridger (GB) b. 24/6/1934, Welwyn, Hertfordshire d. 3/7/1991, Aboyne, Aberdeenshire, Scotland

Tony Brise (GB) b. 28/3/1952, Dartford, Kent d. 29/11/1975, Arkley, nr. Barnet, Hertfordshire:- great talent, killed in Graham Hill's airplane crash

Chris Bristow (GB) b. 2/12/1937, South London d. 19/6/1960, Spa Francorchamps, Belgium: Killed in 1960 Belgian GP

Peter Broeker (CDN) b. 15/5/1929 d. 1980

Tony Brooks (GB) b. 25/2/1932, Dukenfield, Cheshire:- Now retired from running his Weybridge garage, Brooks is now involved in media work & historic racing

Alan Brown (GB) b. 20/11/1919, Malton, Yorkshire:- Became an entrant & team manager for many years

Warwick Brown (AUS) b. 24/12/1949, Sydney, New South Wales:- raced Can-Am for a bit then back to his homeland but not much heard in last 15-20 years.

Adolf Brudes von Breslau (D) b. 15/10/1899, Wrozlav, Poland d. 5/11/1986

Martin Brundle (GB) b. 1/6/1959, King's Lynn, Norfolk:- Mostly doing commentary for ITV, but also races sportscars (espc. Le Mans) & has a hand in the family business with his brothers after his fathers recent death, based nr his home in Gayton, Norfolk

Clemar Bucci (RA) b. 4/9/1920, Zenon Pereyra, Santa Fe:- Still alive & well, still makes historic events

Ronnie Bucknum (USA) b. 5/4/1936, Alhambra, California d. 14/4/1992:- Honda test driver who died of a diabetes-related illness

Ivor Bueb (GB) b. 6/6/1923, Dulwich, London d. 1/8/1959, Clermont-Ferrand, France:- Killed in F2 race

Luiz-Pereira Bueno (BR) b. 16/1/1937, Sao Paulo:- Raced in brazillian touring cars for aeons - still linked to series

Ian Burgess (GB) b. 6/7/1930, London:- Became engineer after retirement

Luciano Burti (BR) b. 5/3/1975, Sao Paulo:- Still in F1, with the Prost team but currently resting after head injuries suffered in the 2001 Belgian GP

Roberto Bussinello (I) b. 4/10/1927, Pistola d. Jan/Feb/Mar 2000:- Most likely to have died in January - but this isn't confirmed yet

Jenson Button (GB) b. 19/1/1980, Frome, Somerset: - Still in F1, driving for the Benetton team

Tommy Byrne (IRL) b. 6/5/1958, Drogheda, Co. Louth:- Now does driver coaching at racing schools in US

Giulio Cabianca (I) b. 19/2/1923, Verona d. 15/6/1961, Modena Aerodrome:- Killed in horrific accient whilst testing F1 Cooper

Alex Caffi (I) b. 18/3/1964, Rovato, Brescia:- now in sportscars

John Campbell-Jones (GB) b. 21/1/1930, Epsom, Surrey

Adrian Campos (E) b. 17/6/1960, Alcira, nr. Valencia:- Now runs team in Spanish Open Fortuna Nissan, helping the careers of Gene & Alonso

John Cannon (CDN) b. 21/6/1937, London, England d. 18/10/1999, Midwest USA:- Killed in light aeroplane crash - I'm working on finding exact location - Kentucky is possible

Eitel Cantoni (U) b. 4/10/1906, Montevideo d. June 1997

Ivan Capelli (I) b. 24/5/1963, Milan:- Now does commentary for Italian digital channel

Piero Carini (I) b. 6/3/1921, Genova d. 30/5/1957, St Etienne, France: - Killed in sportscar race

Eugenio Castelloti (I) b. 10/10/1930, Lodi, Milan d. 14/3/1957, Modena Aerodrome:- Killed in testing whilst driving a Ferrari F1 car

Johnny Cecotto (YV) b. 25/1/1956, Caracas:- Still involved in sportscars, but largely taking a back-seat these days

Francois Cevert (F) b. 25/2/1944, Paris d. 6/10/1973, Watkins Glen Circuit, New York State, USA:-Killed in qualifying for the 1973 US GP.

Eugene Chaboud (F) b. 12/4/1907, Lyon d. 28/12/1983 Montfermeil

Jay Chamberlain (USA) b. 29/12/1925:- Still involved in the US historic car business & Lotus

Dave Charlton (ZA) b. 27/10/1936, Brotton, nr. Redcar, Yorkshire, England:- After retiring in the 80's, dave now races for fun in major historic events & hill-climbs in South Africa & England

Eddie Cheever (USA) b. 10/1/1958, Phoeniz, Arizona:- Now a team-owner in IRl, still races & palns NASCAr in the future. Also does some commentating

Andrea Chiesa (CH) b. 6/5/1964, Milan, Italy:- Sporadic sportscar driver, mostly works in Italian & Swiss media

Ettore Chimeri (YV) b. 4/6/1921 d. 27/2/1960, Cuba:- Killed in sportscar race

Louis Chiron (MC) b. 3/8/1899, Monte Carlo d.22/6/1979, Monte Carlo:- Ran the Monte Carlo rally & the Monaco GP until his death

Johnny Claes (B) b. 11/8/1916, london, England d. 3/2/1956, Brussels:- died of tuberculosis

Jim Clark (GB) b. 4/3/1936, Kilmany, Fifeshire, Scotland d. 7/4/1968, Hockenheim, Germany:- perhaps the greatest of them all, killed in F2 race

Peter Collins (GB) b. 6/11/1931, Kidderminster, Worcestershire d. 3/8/1968, Bonn, Germany- another brilliant driver, killed in the 1958 German GP

Bernard Collomb (F) b. 7/10/1930, Nice

Erik Comas (F) b. 28/9/1963, Romans, nr. Valence:- Mostly in sportscars & has raced all over the world

Gianfranco Comotti (I) b. 24/7/1906, Brescia d. 10/5/1963, Bergamo:- In his later life, worked for BP

George Constantine (USA) b. 22/2/1918 d. 7/1/1968

John Cordts (CDN) b. 23/7/1935, Huntsville

David Coulthard (GB) b. 27/3/1971, Twynholm, Kirkcudbright, Scotland:- Still in F1 with the McLaren team

Piers Courage (GB) b. 27/5/1942, Colchester, Essex d. 21/6/1970, Zandvoort, Netherlands:- Heir of the brewery firm, killed in the 1970 Dutch GP

Chris Craft (GB) b. 17/11/1939, Porthleven, nr. Helston, Cornwall:- involved in the Rocket Roadster with Gordon Murray & still involved in cars to this day

Jim Crawford (GB) b. 13/2/1948, Dunfermline, Fifeshire, Scotland:- Raced in US for ages, also a fisherman

Antonio Creus (E) b. 28/10/1924, Madrid d. 19/2/1996, Madrid

Tony Crook (GB) b. 16/2/1920, Manchester:-Head of Bristol Cars, only just recently retired from day-to-day role

Geoff Crossley (GB) b. 11/5/1921, Baslow, Derbyshire:- Now living in retirement in Oxfordshire

Fritz d'Orey (BR) b. 25/3/1938, Sao Paulo d. ?:- One of the TNF's great mysteries - from what I believe, this man is dead but certainly NOT in 1961 as he survived that crash, however as some believed he was already dead, they haven't researched properly into him, so I can't confirm either way yet - nothing to say he's alive though

Hernano da Silva Ramos (F/BR) b. 7/12/1925, Paris: dual national who made an appearance in Britain in 1999 at the Coy's historic festival

Chuck Daigh (US0 b. 29/11/1923, Long Beach, California:- Still works in engineering to this day

Yannick Dalmas (F) b. 28/7/1961, Le Beausset, nr. Toulon:- Sportscar great with 4 Le Mans wins to his credit

Derek Daly (IRL) b. 11/3/1953, Dundrum, Dublin:- Works in US for Speedvision & also has racing school at Las vegas Motor speedway

Christian Danner (D) b. 4/4/1958, Munich:- Touring Cars & possible organiser of new series of the field in Germany - also does TV work

Jorge Daponte (RA) b. 5/6/1923, Buenos Aires d. 9/3/1963

Colin Davis (GB) b. 29/7/1932, London

Count Carel Godin de Beaufort (NL) b. 10/4/1934, Maarsbergen d. 3/8/1964, Dusseldorf, Germany:- privateer hurt in practice for the German GP at Nurburgring & died 3 days later

Mario Araujo de Cabral (P) b. 15/1/1934, Oporto: - Now happily retired

Andrea de Cesaris (I) b. 31/5/1959, Rome:- Also now happily retired

Maria Teresa de Filippis (I) b. 11/11/1926, Naples: - Still involved in historic racing & administration

Piet de Klerk (ZA) b. 16/3/1935, Pilgrim's Rest, Transvaal:- retired late 80's, still visits races

Pedro de la Rosa (E) b. 24/2/1971, Barcelona:- Races for the Jaguar F1 team

Alfonso de Portago (E) b. 11/10/1928, London, England d. 12/5/1957 between Goito & Guidizzolo, Italy:- colorful Spanish nobleman killed in Mille Migila

Max de Terra (CH) b. 6/10/1918 d. 29/12/1982

Alessandro de Tomaso (RA) b. 10/7/1928, Buenos Aires:- Involved in F1 & road car projects for many years- Still in car industry

Baron Charles de Tornaco (B) b. 7/6/1927, Brussels d. 18/9/1953, Modena Aerodrome, Italy:- killed in F1 testing crash

Emilio de Villota (E) b. 26/7/1946, Madrid:- Still races, mainly in Spain, in support races

Jean-Denis Deletraz (CH) b. 1/10/1963, Geneva:- Now in sportscars

Patrick Depailler (F) b. 9/8/1944, Clermont-Ferrrand d. 1/8/1980, Hockenheim, Germany:- Fast but accident prone driver, killed in F1 testing crash

Pedro Paulo Diniz (BR) b. 22/5/1970, Sao Paulo:- Retired as a driver, now involved in Prost F1's management

Jose Dolhem (F) b. 26/4/1944, Paris d. 16/4/1988, nr. St Etienne: - killed in private plane crash

Martin Donnelly (GB) b. 26/3/1964, Belfast, Northern Ireland:- After injuries in Spanish GP practice, he retired, now involved in junior single-seater formulae

Mark Donohue (USA) b. 18/3/1937, Summit, New Jersey d. 19/8/1975, Graz, Austria:- died after practice in the Austrian GP

Paddy Driver (ZA) b. 19/5/1934, Johannesburg:- raced until the 80's, retired now

Johnny Dumfries (GB) b. 26/4/1958, Rothesay, Isle of Bute, Scotland: - now a businessman as well as the Earl of Dumfries

Paul Emery (GB) b. 12/11/1916, Chiswick, London d. 3/2/1992, Epson, Surrey

Tomas Enge (CZ) b. 11/9/1976, Liberec:- Made his debut in latter 2001 season for Prost. 2002 unclear at mo.

Paul England (AUS) b. 28/3/1929

Harald Ertl (A) b. 31/8/1948, Zell am See d. 7/4/1982, nr. Glessen, Germany:- journalist killed in light plane crash

Nasif Estefano (RA) b. 18/11/1932, Concepcion, Tucuman d. 21/10/1973:- died in Argentine endurance event

Philippe Etancelin (F) b. 28/12/1896, Rouen d. 13/10/1981, Neuilly sur Seine, nr. Paris

Bob Evans (GB) b. 11/6/1947, Waddington, Lincolnshire:- Still does the odd historic event

Corrado Fabi (I) b. 12/4/1961, Milan:- Looks after the family business

Teo Fabi (I) b. 9/3/1955, Milan:- Last in racing in CART in 1996, has done the odd race or two in US since

Pascal Fabre (F) b. 9/1/1960, Lyon:- still involved in sportscars

Luigi Fagioli (I) b. 9/6/1898, Osimo nr Ancona d. 20/6/1952, Monte Carlo, Monaco: - died of injuries from Monaco GP for sportscars

Jack Fairman (GB) b. 15/3/1913, Smallfield, nr. Horley, Surrey:- Ran a garage business in London for many years - until the early 90's

Christian Fittipaldi (BR) b. 18/1/1961, Sao Paulo:- Still in CART
